svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - April 20 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
April 20, 2024" date: "2024-04-20"
Eth News and Links
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
â€¢ Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim : Electra included
EIPs : EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after pectra-devnet-0 and
proposal to apply deposit to state when epoch finalized EIP7549 move committee index outside
attestation : discussion on handling Deneb attestations at fork boundary and proposal to replace
committee bits with indices Electra proposed additions: EIP7685 general purpose execution layer
requests: consolidate request types, decide Monday on including EIP7691 blob throughput increase:
short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to be based on testing, alternative to EIP7659 stepped
increase Electra candidates for inclusion : EIP7547 inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074 canâ€™t be
resolved for Electra Node-id mapping to attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
â€¢ Electra included EIPs : EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after
pectra-devnet-0 and proposal to apply deposit to state when epoch finalized EIP7549 move committee
index outside attestation : discussion on handling Deneb attestations at fork boundary and proposal to
replace committee bits with indices
Electra included EIPs :
â€¢ EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after pectra-devnet-0 and
proposal to apply deposit to state when epoch finalized
EIP7251 maxEB : changing to execution layer triggered consolidations after pectra-devnet-0 and
â€¢ EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : discussion on handling Deneb attestations at fork
boundary and proposal to replace committee bits with indices
EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : discussion on handling Deneb attestations at fork
â€¢ Electra proposed additions: EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests: consolidate request
types, decide Monday on including EIP7691 blob throughput increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS,
exact values to be based on testing, alternative to EIP7659 stepped increase
Electra proposed additions:
â€¢ EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests: consolidate request types, decide Monday on
including
EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests: consolidate request types, decide Monday on
â€¢ EIP7691 blob throughput increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to be based on
testing, alternative to EIP7659 stepped increase
EIP7691 blob throughput increase: short term scaling before PeerDAS, exact values to be based on
â€¢ Electra candidates for inclusion : EIP7547 inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074 canâ€™t be resolved
for Electra
Electra candidates for inclusion :
â€¢ EIP7547 inclusion lists : issues with EIP3074 canâ€™t be resolved for Electra
â€¢ Node-id mapping to attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
Node-id mapping to attestation subnets: clarification for mainnet & PeerDAS
â€¢ consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.0 : initial Electra spec for pectra-devnet-0
consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.0 : initial Electra spec for pectra-devnet-0
â€¢ Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko & Christine Kim : Pectra
upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIPs added to Pectra & will be part of pectra-devnet-0 :
EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes EIP2935 save historical block hashes in state EIPs considered for
inclusion : EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity & any potential issues with Verkle
EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size EIP7547 IL
(inclusion lists) : some opposition to including Osaka upgrade EIPs considered for inclusion: EIP7667
raise gas costs of hash functions
Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko & Christine Kim :
â€¢ Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIPs added to Pectra & will be part of
pectra-devnet-0 : EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes EIP2935 save historical block hashes in state EIPs
considered for inclusion : EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity & any potential issues
with Verkle EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size EIP7547
IL (inclusion lists) : some opposition to including
Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024)
â€¢ EIPs added to Pectra & will be part of pectra-devnet-0 : EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes EIP2935 save
historical block hashes in state

issues with Verkle EIP7623 increase call data cost: need to consider best mechanism to cap block size

EOF: need to assess cross client testing complexity & any potential issues with Verkle

Lightclient: addressing EIP3074 concerns

â€¢ EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance) Breakout call video & notes : staking providers
prefer execution layer triggered consolidations (consolidations not in pectra-devnet-0) and donâ€™t need
custom ceilings
EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance)
â€¢ Breakout call video & notes : staking providers prefer execution layer triggered consolidations
(consolidations not in pectra-devnet-0) and donâ€™t need custom ceilings

Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
â€¢ ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold
â€¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority Consensus layer:
Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
â€¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
â€¢ Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
â€¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
â€¢ ePBS Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec Terence: with ePBS you may choose to
trust relayers instead of having to trust them
ePBS
â€¢ Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec
Potuz: ePBS spec notes and ePBS forkchoice annotated spec
â€¢ Terence: with ePBS you may choose to trust relayers instead of having to trust them

WahrstÃ¤tterâ€™s correlated attestation penalties analysis

â€¢ Issuance change proposals: Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total costs for users
Reward curve with capped issuance , alternative to tempered issuance Why exogenous rewards must be
considered in the issuance debate
Issuance change proposals:
â€¢ Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total costs for users
Minimum viable issuance creates value by reducing total costs for users

Reward curve with capped issuance , alternative to tempered issuance

â€¢ ethPandaOps: Assertoor : cross-client integration testing tool, higher abstraction level than Hive
Tracoor : beacon data & execution trace explorer to identify & address network problems Guide to using
Kurtosis & ethereum-package to launch local devnets
ethPandaOps:
â€¢ Assertoor : cross-client integration testing tool, higher abstraction level than Hive

EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIPs: EIP7684 : Return deposits for distinct credentials EIP7685 : General purpose execution layer
requests EIP7686 : Linear EVM memory limits EIP7688 : Forward compatible consensus data structures
EIP7691 : Blob throughput increase Meta EIP7692 : EVM Object Format (EOF) Meta EIP7693 :
Backward-compatible post-quantum migration

multiplication)

â€¢ ERCs (application layer): ERC7680 : Valued tokens with layered liquidity ERC7681 : Dual nature
multi-token protocol (ERC20 & ERC1155) ERC7682 : Auxiliary funds capability ERC7683 : Cross chain
intents ( proposed by Uniswap & Across Protocol ) ERC7687 : AUTHCALL ERC4626 deposit/withdraw
extension ERC7689 : Smart blobs (state machine on top of blobs) ERC7690 : Union lock (based on
TSTORE/TLOAD) ERC7694 : Solana storage handler for CCIP-Write ERC7695 : Ownership delegation and
context for NFTs

Stuff for developers
â€¢ Remix v0.47.0 : adds Solidity Copilot using SolCoder LLM, pin contracts deployed to Remix VM and
DappDraft plugin to generate a front end
Remix v0.47.0 : adds Solidity Copilot using SolCoder LLM, pin contracts deployed to Remix VM and
â€¢ Foundry: Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract Forge verify-bytecode :
verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract OpenZeppelin Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage
upgradeable contracts with safety checks
Foundry:
â€¢ Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract
Forge clone : create Foundry project from a verified contract
â€¢ Forge verify-bytecode : verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract
Forge verify-bytecode : verify code at a commit hash matches deployed contract
â€¢ OpenZeppelin Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage upgradeable contracts with safety checks
OpenZeppelin Foundry Upgrades : deploy/manage upgradeable contracts with safety checks

Token types (Solidity): drop-in replacements for interfaces; ERC20, ERC721, ERC721Receiver, ERC4626 &
ERC6909
â€¢ Solhint community v4 : config files per subdirectory, improved exit code handling, saner defaults,
single rule for casing & redefined recommended ruleset
Solhint community v4 : config files per subdirectory, improved exit code handling, saner defaults,

aliases

Vyper interface scanner : detecting incorrect interface definitions

digest) cheats and makeAddr functions from forge-std

â€¢ Sub Zero : mine vanity addresses using CREATE2, tokenized as ERC721 NFTs

â€¢ Viem experimental : adds EIP3074 sign & verify auth message and recover signing address from auth
message
Viem experimental : adds EIP3074 sign & verify auth message and recover signing address from auth

Security

Onchain stats
â€¢ Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.0 to 586.3 gwei, with 17.5 gwei average Zero net issuance
currently at 23.0 gwei 4.1k ETH net issuance this week

sentencing scheduled for July 29
